segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 8
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 8

segments.pli: 8. Yamakavagga
segments.en: 8. Pairs

segments.pli: 74. Dutiyamaraṇassatisutta
segments.en: 74. Mindfulness of Death (2nd)

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā nātike viharati giñjakāvasathe.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying at Nādika in the brick house.

segments.pli: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi … pe …
segments.en: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:

segments.pli: maraṇassati, bhikkhave, bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā amatogadhā amatapariyosānā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, when mindfulness of death is developed and cultivated it’s very fruitful and beneficial. It culminates in the deathless and ends with the deathless.

segments.pli: Kathaṃ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, maraṇassati kathaṃ bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā amatogadhā amatapariyosānā?
segments.en: And how is mindfulness of death developed and cultivated to be very fruitful and beneficial, to culminate in the deathless and end with the deathless?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu divase nikkhante rattiyā patihitāya iti paṭisañcikkhati:
segments.en: As day passes by and night draws close, a mendicant reflects:

segments.pli: ‘bahukā kho me paccayā maraṇassa—
segments.en: ‘I might die of many causes.

segments.pli: ahi vā maṃ ḍaṃseyya, vicchiko vā maṃ ḍaṃseyya, satapadī vā maṃ ḍaṃseyya;
segments.en: A snake might bite me, or a scorpion or centipede might sting me.

segments.pli: tena me assa kālakiriyā. So mama assa antarāyo.
segments.en: And if I died from that it would be an obstacle to me.

segments.pli: Upakkhalitvā vā papateyyaṃ, bhattaṃ vā me bhuttaṃ byāpajjeyya, pittaṃ vā me kuppeyya, semhaṃ vā me kuppeyya, satthakā vā me vātā kuppeyyuṃ, manussā vā maṃ upakkameyyuṃ, amanussā vā maṃ upakkameyyuṃ;
segments.en: Or I might stumble off a cliff, or get food poisoning, or suffer a disturbance of bile, phlegm, or piercing winds. Or I might be attacked by humans or non-humans.

segments.pli: tena me assa kālakiriyā. So mama assa antarāyo’ti.
segments.en: And if I died from that it would be an obstacle to me.’

segments.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā iti paṭisañcikkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: That mendicant should reflect:

segments.pli: ‘atthi nu kho me pāpakā akusalā dhammā appahīnā ye me assu rattiṃ kālaṃ karontassa antarāyāyā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Are there any bad, unskillful qualities that I haven’t given up, which might be an obstacle to me if I die tonight?’

segments.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:
segments.en: Suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that

segments.pli: ‘atthi me pāpakā akusalā dhammā appahīnā ye me assu rattiṃ kālaṃ karontassa antarāyāyā’ti, tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya adhimatto chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañca karaṇīyaṃ.
segments.en: there are such bad, unskillful qualities. Then in order to give them up they should apply outstanding enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, ādittacelo vā ādittasīso vā tasseva celassa vā sīsassa vā nibbāpanāya adhimattaṃ chandañca vāyāmañca ussāhañca ussoḷhiñca appaṭivāniñca satiñca sampajaññañca kareyya;
segments.en: Suppose your clothes or head were on fire. In order to extinguish it, you’d apply intense enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tena bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya adhimatto chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañca karaṇīyaṃ.
segments.en: In the same way, in order to give up those bad, unskillful qualities, that mendicant should apply outstanding enthusiasm …

segments.pli: Sace pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:
segments.en: But suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that

segments.pli: ‘natthi me pāpakā akusalā dhammā appahīnā ye me assu rattiṃ kālaṃ karontassa antarāyāyā’ti, tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
segments.en: there are no such bad, unskillful qualities. Then that mendicant should meditate with rapture and joy, training day and night in skillful qualities.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu rattiyā nikkhantāya divase patihite iti paṭisañcikkhati:
segments.en: Or else, as night passes by and day draws close, a mendicant reflects:

segments.pli: ‘bahukā kho me paccayā maraṇassa—
segments.en: ‘I might die of many causes.

segments.pli: ahi vā maṃ ḍaṃseyya, vicchiko vā maṃ ḍaṃseyya, satapadī vā maṃ ḍaṃseyya;
segments.en: A snake might bite me, or a scorpion or centipede might sting me.

segments.pli: tena me assa kālakiriyā. So mama assa antarāyo.
segments.en: And if I died from that it would be an obstacle to me.

segments.pli: Upakkhalitvā vā papateyyaṃ, bhattaṃ vā me bhuttaṃ byāpajjeyya, pittaṃ vā me kuppeyya, semhaṃ vā me kuppeyya, satthakā vā me vātā kuppeyyuṃ, manussā vā maṃ upakkameyyuṃ, amanussā vā maṃ upakkameyyuṃ;
segments.en: Or I might stumble off a cliff, or get food poisoning, or suffer a disturbance of bile, phlegm, or piercing winds. Or I might be attacked by humans or non-humans.

segments.pli: tena me assa kālakiriyā. So mama assa antarāyo’ti.
segments.en: And if I died from that it would be an obstacle to me.’

segments.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā iti paṭisañcikkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: That mendicant should reflect:

segments.pli: ‘atthi nu kho me pāpakā akusalā dhammā appahīnā ye me assu divā kālaṃ karontassa antarāyāyā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Are there any bad, unskillful qualities that I haven’t given up, which might be an obstacle to me if I die today?’

segments.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:
segments.en: Suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that

segments.pli: ‘atthi me pāpakā akusalā dhammā appahīnā ye me assu divā kālaṃ karontassa antarāyāyā’ti, tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya adhimatto chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañca karaṇīyaṃ.
segments.en: there are such bad, unskillful qualities. Then in order to give them up they should apply outstanding enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, ādittacelo vā ādittasīso vā tasseva celassa vā sīsassa vā nibbāpanāya adhimattaṃ chandañca vāyāmañca ussāhañca ussoḷhiñca appaṭivāniñca satiñca sampajaññañca kareyya;
segments.en: Suppose your clothes or head were on fire. In order to extinguish it, you’d apply intense enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tena bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya adhimatto chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañca karaṇīyaṃ.
segments.en: In the same way, in order to give up those bad, unskillful qualities, that mendicant should apply outstanding enthusiasm …

segments.pli: Sace pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:
segments.en: But suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that

segments.pli: ‘natthi me pāpakā akusalā dhammā appahīnā ye me assu divā kālaṃ karontassa antarāyāyā’ti, tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
segments.en: there are no such bad, unskillful qualities. Then that mendicant should meditate with rapture and joy, training day and night in skillful qualities.

segments.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitā kho, bhikkhave, maraṇassati evaṃ bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā amatogadhā amatapariyosānā”ti.
segments.en: Mindfulness of death, when developed and cultivated in this way, is very fruitful and beneficial. It culminates in the deathless and ends with the deathless.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying at Nādika…

suttaplex.blurb: A mendicant should reflect each night on the dangers that lie around them, and practice mindfulness of death with urgency to give up the unwholesome.
